answers.author: Michael Smith
answers.text:
Yes, The City of Oklahoma City has one organization-wide ADA Coordinator; our General Services Director, Paula Falkenstein.  Every department has at least one ADA coordinator and our larger departments have multiple coordinators.  Our Labor and Employee Relations Division in the Personnel department respond to issues regarding employees and the Code Enforcement Division in the Development Services department respond to building codes.  Response to residents depends on the nature of complaint and who receives the complaint.  Either the ADA Coordinator or the department who receives the complaint will respond.
Training for staff is facilitated thru Quarterly ADA Coordinators Meetings which focus on the pertinent topics or the immediate training need at that time. Oklahoma does not currently have a certification as such for the ADA. Oklahoma City is developing a training course for construction contractors and their personnel to identify important ADA specifications and requirements.

author: Elaine Schmerbeck
text: The City of Goodyear is interested how others coordinate their ADA functions.  Do you have one organization-wide coordinator?  Multiple coordinators within departments?  Who responds to issues regarding employees, residents, building codes (city owned and other)? Also, how do you facilitate ongoing certification/training for staff?
title: ADA coordination
